hook yo insert hook through the back loop of next st and draw up a loop yo pull through 2 loops 3 times * yo insert hook and draw up a loop through the 1st pull through from the hook yo insert hook through the back loop of next st and draw up a loop yo pull through 2 loops 3 times repeat from * 1 more time yo and pull through all 4 loops on hook stitches that begin a new round loaddtr remove working loop from hook and make 4 yo s with the slack yarn replace working loop back on the hook some of the slack yarn still remains unused yo pull through 2 loops 4 times loadtrtr remove working loop from hook and make 5 yo s with the slack yarn replace working loop back on the hook some of the slack yarn still remains unused yo pull through 2 loops 5 times restoredr3to remove working loop from hook g put marked loop back on hook and remove marker using slack yarn make 3 yo s to the left of the loop on the hook replace working loop back on the hook 5 loops on hook with the yo s sitting between the working loop and the marked loop yo pull through 2 loops 3 times * yo insert hook and draw up a loop through the 1st pull-through from the hook yo insert hook through the back loop of next st and draw up a loop yo pull through 2 loops 3 times repeat from * 1 more time yo and pull through all 4 loops on hook 3 pattern notes pattern sequence to give you an overview the instructions for working the end-less flowers are set out in stages and should be worked in the sequence described below the first 2 stages occur on foundation row and involve the individual flowers the first 3 rounds of a new flower are worked in stage 1 since the first rounds are worked in exactly the same way for every flower in the project the abbreviation wfrs work first rounds is used for this stage so to wfrs follow the instructions as set out below for stage 2 you will be working the fourth round of the current flower until the breakaway point is reached the breakaway point is where you pause work on the current flower and start a new one by going back to stage 1 so for each foundation row you will be alternating between stage 1 and stage 2 until you have the required number of flowers for the row stage 3 happens on return row and this is where you finish off the flowers established in the most recent foundation row except for
